sentence1: Dan's parents were overweight.
sentence2: Dan was overweight as well.
sentence3: The doctors told his parents it was unhealthy.
sentence4: His parents understood and decided to make a change.
sentence5: They got themselves and Dan on a diet.

sentence1: Carrie had just learned how to ride a bike.
sentence2: She didn't have a bike of her own.
sentence3: Carrie would sneak rides on her sister's bike.
sentence4: She got nervous on a hill and crashed into a wall.
sentence5: The bike frame bent and Carrie got a deep gash on her leg.

sentence1: Morgan enjoyed long walks on the beach.
sentence2: She and her boyfriend decided to go for a long walk.
sentence3: After walking for over a mile, something happened.
sentence4: Morgan decided to propose to her boyfriend.
sentence5: Her boyfriend was upset he didn't propose to her first.

sentence1: Jane was working at a diner.
sentence2: Suddenly, a customer barged up to the counter.
sentence3: He began yelling about how long his food was taking.
sentence4: Jane didn't know how to react.
sentence5: Luckily, her coworker intervened and calmed the man down.

sentence1: I was talking to my crush today.
sentence2: She continued to complain about guys flirting with her.
sentence3: I decided to agree with what she says and listened to her patiently.
sentence4: After I got home, I got a text from her.
sentence5: She asked if we can hang out tomorrow.

sentence1: Frank had been drinking beer.
sentence2: He got a call from his girlfriend, asking where he was.
sentence3: Frank suddenly realized he had a date that night.
sentence4: Since Frank was already a bit drunk, he could not drive.
sentence5: Frank spent the rest of the night drinking more beers.

sentence1: Dave was in the Bahamas on vacation.
sentence2: He decided to go snorkeling on his second day.
sentence3: While snorkeling, he saw a cave up ahead.
sentence4: He went into the cave, and he was terrified when he found a shark!
sentence5: Dave swam away as fast as he could, but the shark caught and ate Dave.

sentence1: Sunny enjoyed going to the beach.
sentence2: As she stepped out of her car, she realized she forgot something.
sentence3: It was quite sunny and she forgot her sunglasses.
sentence4: Sunny got back into her car and heading towards the mall.
sentence5: Sunny found some sunglasses and headed back to the beach.

sentence1: Sally was happy when her widowed mom found a new man.
sentence2: She discovered her siblings didn't feel the same.
sentence3: Sally flew to visit her mom and her mom's new husband.
sentence4: Although her mom was obviously in love, he was nothing like her dad.
sentence5: Sally went home and wondered about her parents' marriage.

sentence1: Dan hit his golf ball and watched it go.
sentence2: The ball bounced on the grass and into the sand trap.
sentence3: Dan pretended that his ball actually landed on the green.
sentence4: His friends were not paying attention so they believed him.
sentence5: Dan snuck a ball on the green and made his putt from 10 feet.

sentence1: Josh had a parrot that talked.
sentence2: He brought his parrot to school.
sentence3: During show and tell, Josh's parrot said a bad word.
sentence4: The teacher told Joshua not to bring his bird again.
sentence5: When Josh got home, he was grounded.

sentence1: Hal was walking his dog one morning.
sentence2: A cat ran across their path.
sentence3: Hal's dog strained so hard, the leash broke!
sentence4: He chased the cat for several minutes.
sentence5: Finally Hal lured him back to his side.

sentence1: Brenda was in love with her boyfriend Maxwell.
sentence2: He was a successful artist with a promising future.
sentence3: Maxwell told Brenda he needed to talk to her.
sentence4: She thought he'd propose but he wanted to break up.
sentence5: Brenda walked away and now she is the saddest girl out of everyone.

sentence1: Yanice opened the fridge and found nothing to eat.
sentence2: However, there were leftovers.
sentence3: She mixed it up in an attempt to make lunch.
sentence4: Since the place needed meat, she also fried and eggs.
sentence5: She ended up enjoying the meal.

sentence1: I saw my friend Joe sitting in lobby today.
sentence2: I kept him company, as he is a lonely old man.
sentence3: He told me he had just listened to Beethoven's Ninth.
sentence4: I talked to him for an hour.
sentence5: I left him in the lobby and told him I would see him soon.

sentence1: Twas the night after the first day of junior high.
sentence2: Amy and her friend Beth were on the phone.
sentence3: They had a lot to catch up on.
sentence4: Amy listened patiently as Beth told her about her day.
sentence5: She wanted to go 2nd because she knew hers was the better day.

sentence1: I knew of a young man who won the lottery.
sentence2: He used to ride lawn mowers.
sentence3: After he won, he went on to using drugs.
sentence4: He blew a lot of money.
sentence5: Eventually his winnings were revoked after a dui.

sentence1: A die hard shopper was waiting in the long line outside.
sentence2: It was miserably cold.
sentence3: The shopper saw a homeless man shivering in the alleyway.
sentence4: He gave up his place in the line and brought a gift back from his car.
sentence5: The shopper gave the homeless man a nice warm blanket.

sentence1: Jeff invited his friends over to play board games on Saturday night.
sentence2: They arrived at his house early that evening.
sentence3: The six of them sat around a big table.
sentence4: They took turns deciding which game to play.
sentence5: They spent six hours playing different board games.

sentence1: Chuck reclined on the back porch as he sipped his morning coffee.
sentence2: Today he would finally screen in this back porch.
sentence3: He gathered his tools and material supplies.
sentence4: He labored all day to finish the job.
sentence5: That night he snuggled with his wife on the bug free porch.

sentence1: Jessica decided she wanted to go to the beach.
sentence2: She invited all her friends to go along.
sentence3: They had a great time, but covered in a lot of sticky sand.
sentence4: They searched for a shower for what felt like ages.
sentence5: Finally they found one and decided it was the best trip ever.

sentence1: Dan wanted a pet for Christmas.
sentence2: He told his dad.
sentence3: His dad listened, but didn't say anything.
sentence4: So on Christmas morning, And got a wonderful surprise.
sentence5: He received a puppy with a shiny bow on it's head!

sentence1: Kelly and her friends decided to have a hot dog contest.
sentence2: The girls competed against each other.
sentence3: They had to make the best tasting one.
sentence4: When it was over, Kelly won.
sentence5: She won a medal.

sentence1: Dan was watching a Youtube video.
sentence2: His mom was in the kitchen, doing dishes.
sentence3: Suddenly, Dan ran into the kitchen and started crying.
sentence4: He had just seen a video of a man trampled by an elephant.
sentence5: His mom made Youtube off limits to Dan.

sentence1: Jeff wanted to move out of his house.
sentence2: He had no money to pay for a new one.
sentence3: One day he bought a scratching ticket.
sentence4: He won enough money for a down payment.
sentence5: Jeff ended up moving to a new house.

sentence1: I was walking to school.
sentence2: Since I wasn't looking at my feet, I stepped on a rock.
sentence3: I landed on the ground in pain.
sentence4: Thankfully, a stranger rushed to pick me up.
sentence5: He took me to the hospital to seek treatment.

sentence1: Lily drove into town for some errands.
sentence2: While she was there, she bought a large iced coffee to go.
sentence3: It was delicious and refreshing and she couldn't wait to finish it.
sentence4: She put it on her car roof while fishing for her keys.
sentence5: She drove home and the coffee fell off and spilled.

sentence1: Todd was hungry.
sentence2: He did not have anything to cook at his house.
sentence3: He decided he need to go buy something to cook.
sentence4: On the way to the store Todd decided to make hamburgers.
sentence5: Todd buys everything he needed and goes home and cooks.

sentence1: Virgil brought home a bright blue recliner he had found online.
sentence2: His wife thought it was hideous and clashed with the decor.
sentence3: Virgil bought some fabric and had it reupholstered.
sentence4: His wife complained again, saying bright green still clashed.
sentence5: Virgil gave up and threw the recliner away.
